fractured-reverie.title: Fractured Reverie (PC, Steam)
fractured-reverie.overview: Overview: A psychological horror game with a branching storyline. You play as Ray, a six-year-old who wakes in his bedroom, sensing something off. After his mother gives him medicine, he awakens in a hospital—and each time he falls asleep in one place, he wakes up in the other. The loop repeats as you investigate what’s real and uncover the truth.
fractured-reverie.systems: Key Systems: Branching narrative built with ScriptableObjects; physics-based item interaction (pick up/inspect) via raycasts and constraints

fruits-bomber.title: Fruits Bomber (Android)
fruits-bomber.overview: Overview: A bright and approachable Android puzzler where kids drag and drop to sort colorful fruits. Short levels, clear goals, and soft haptic/audio cues build confidence, while adaptive difficulty keeps the challenge just right. Crafted for touch, it’s easy to pick up, safe for kids, and perfect for quick learning-through-play moments.
fruits-bomber.systems: Key Systems: Drag-and-drop sorting with magnetic snap and reliable collision checks, combined with a four-direction fruit spawner/shooter that feeds lane-based trajectories.

ubcroid.title: UBCRoid
ubcroid.overview: Overview: An outer-space, short-session arcade shooter where monsters swarm the screen and you push forward with quick, accurate gunplay. Survive, adapt, and chart a path through the unknown without getting taken down. A school project at UBC for CPSC 427.
ubcroid.systems: Key Systems: A* pathfinding for select enemies to navigate dynamic obstacles; decision-tree AI for readable, tunable behavior logic; a custom AABB collision and response pipeline for fast, deterministic hits; and physics-driven character behaviors that translate directly into responsive, skill-based combat.

fly-through.title: Fly Through
fly-through.overview: Overview: A level-based 3D mobile game where you pilot a spaceship through obstacle-packed courses, warping between areas via portals. Mechanics like inverted controls and other devious gimmicks test quick reactions and precise piloting. Short stages and instant retries keep you chasing higher scores and faster times.

forest-escape.title: Forest Escape
forest-escape.overview: Overview: A prototype for a 2.5D puzzle game. Built around side-on play with depth shifts and perspective tricks that create spatial puzzles. Push-blocks, switches, and synchronized/unsynchronized platforms enable varied solutions from minimal inputs. Short stages and instant retries keep iteration fast and satisfying.
